org.bulldog.core.gpio

Interface AnalogInput

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PinFeature
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAnalogInput, BBBAnalogInput

    public interface AnalogInput
extends PinFeature
    This interface specified the operations that can be used on a Pin that is configured as an analog input.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double read()
      Reads the voltage that is currently applied to the pin.
      double[] sample(int amountSamples)
      Grabs a number of readings from the analog input in short succession.
      double[] sample(int amountSamples, float frequency)
      Grabs a number of readings from the analog input, sampled with the specified frequency.
      java.util.concurrent.Future<double[]> sampleAsync(int amountSamples)
      Grabs a number of readings asynchronously from the analog input in short succession.
      java.util.concurrent.Future<double[]> sampleAsync(int amountSamples, float frequency)
      Grabs a number of readings asynchronously from the analog input, sampled with the specified frequency.
      void startMonitor(int periodMicroSeconds, ThresholdListener listener)
      Start a monitor on the analog input.
      void stopMonitor()
      Stops the monitor that currently listens on the pin.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.bulldog.core.gpio.PinFeature

        blockPin, getName, getPin, isActivatedFeature, isBlocking, isSetup, setup, teardown, unblockPin

    • Method Detail

      • read

        double read()
        Reads the voltage that is currently applied to the pin.
        Returns:
        A value ranging from 0.0 to 1.0. This is the percentage of the voltage reference value that is currently applied on this pin.

      • sample

        double[] sample(int amountSamples)
        Grabs a number of readings from the analog input in short succession.
        Parameters:
        amountSamples - the amount samples to be taken
        Returns:
        an array of values ranging between 0.0 and 1.0. These represent the percentage of the voltage reference that were supplied to the pin when the measurement was taken.

      • sample

        double[] sample(int amountSamples,
              float frequency)
        Grabs a number of readings from the analog input, sampled with the specified frequency.
        Parameters:
        amountSamples - the amount samples to be taken
        frequency - the frequency that should be used for sampling
        Returns:
        an array of values ranging between 0.0 and 1.0. These represent the percentage of the voltage reference that were supplied to the pin when the measurement was taken.

      • sampleAsync

        java.util.concurrent.Future<double[]> sampleAsync(int amountSamples)
        Grabs a number of readings asynchronously from the analog input in short succession. The program will continue execution while the samples are being taken.
        Parameters:
        amountSamples - the amount samples to be taken
        Returns:
        A future containing an array of the sampled values. These values range between 0.0 and 1.0, which represents the percentage of the reference voltage that has been measured.

      • sampleAsync

        java.util.concurrent.Future<double[]> sampleAsync(int amountSamples,
                                                float frequency)
        Grabs a number of readings asynchronously from the analog input, sampled with the specified frequency. The program will continue execution while the samples are being taken.
        Parameters:
        amountSamples - the amount samples to be taken
        frequency - the frequency that should be used for sampling
        Returns:
        A future containing an array of the sampled values. These values range between 0.0 and 1.0, which represents the percentage of the reference voltage that has been measured.

      • startMonitor

        void startMonitor(int periodMicroSeconds,
                ThresholdListener listener)
        Start a monitor on the analog input. It will check the value on the analog input periodically, as specified with the periodMicroSeconds argument. When the threshold has been reached the listener's thresholdReached method will be called.
        Parameters:
        periodMicroSeconds - the period micro seconds
        listener - the listener

      • stopMonitor

        void stopMonitor()
        Stops the monitor that currently listens on the pin.
